item.title: "The white conservatives aren‚Äôt friends of the Negro...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The white conservatives aren‚Äôt friends of the Negro either, but they at least don‚Äôt try to hide it. They are like wolves; they show their teeth in a snarl that keeps the Negro always aware of where he stands with them. But the white liberals are foxes, who also show their teeth to the Negro but pretend that they are smiling‚Ä¶ One is the wolf, the other is a fox. No matter what, they‚Äôll both eat you.‚Äù ‚Äî Malcolm X

item.title: Call to Action! Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Call to Action!
Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on Senator Hickenlooper to support immigrant communities!

This week, Senator Hickenlooper turned his back on the immigrant community in Colorado and around the country by supporting a move to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. While the vote was non-binding, he needs to hear from constituents that these decisions that hurt those most vulnerable to the pandemic will not be tolerated, bef...ore he does it again.

Sanctuary 4 All, a grassroots organization that advocates for the immigrant community in Colorado, has put out a call to action for Coloradans to voice their anger over Hickenlooper‚Äôs vote.

WHY: Coloradans elected Senator Hickenlooper to support everyone, regardless of their legal status. He needs to know that this is an unacceptable position to take and that we will hold him accountable.

HOW: Call Senator Hickenlooper today at 202-224-5941 to let him know that everyone deserves relief from the COVID-19 pandemic and that his actions matter to the people of Colorado.

SAMPLE SCRIPT:
My name is [FULL NAME] and I live in [COMMUNITY/ZIP CODE].
I am calling because I am deeply disturbed by Senator Hickenlooper‚Äôs vote to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. Everyone in Colorado and around the country deserves support during this pandemic, especially immigrant communities that can be even more vulnerable. As his constituent, I will continue to hold Hickenlooper accountable for all of his votes and demand that he support immigrant families.

GOAL: DSURJ‚Äôs goal is to generate at least 20 calls by the end of the weekend to send a clear message to Hickenlooper that we are watching each and every one of his votes.

Comment below to let us know you've reached out and please share!

See More

---

Congressman Joe Neguse invites you to join him for a bilingual town hall to discuss President Biden's recent executive orders on immigration, as well as proposed legislation.

This virtual event will be hosted in Spanish and English with interpretation for both languages.

Panelists:

‚Ä¢ U.S. Congressman Joe Neguse

‚Ä¢ Violeta R. Chapin, Clinical Professor of Law, University of Colorado Law School

‚Ä¢ Marissa Molina, Colorado State Director, fwd.us

‚Ä¢ Jorge Loweree, American Immigration Council

‚Ä¢ Johanna Ulloa, Poudre River Public Library/Rep. Neguse Latino Advisory Council

Register here: neguse2021.com

Please make sure you have the latest version of Zoom updated, so that you can access the interpretation feature. And if you plan to join by phone, you will need to use the Zoom app.

FRI, FEB 5

Bilingual Immigration Town Hall

item.title: Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unaccept...able. Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could‚Äôve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unacceptable. Call his ...office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could‚Äôve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

item.title: Not1More and AFSC member Hilda Martinez was captured by border...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Not1More and AFSC member Hilda Martinez was captured by border patrol, leaving her children with their aunt and without aacces to a parent (their father was deported previously).

Hilda will see a judge tomorrow (Thursday) in New Mexico.

Hilda and her children came to some of the car rallies Abolish ICE Denver held this year and is a beloved member of the immigrant rights community!

item.title: "Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages of 5 and 14. She‚Äôs the sole provider and breadwinner since her husband, Ivan, was deported last year. Hilda is a community leader with the American Friends Service Committee in Colorado.

This past week, Hilda was in the El Paso area to visit family. On January 27, 2021 HIlda was traveling with other people in a vehicle and they were stopped at a Border Patrol checkpoint. She was arrested and is now charged with "smu...ggling Ixxxxxl aliens‚Äù. She is detained at he Dona Ana County Detention Center in New Mexico awaiting hearings this week. Funds will support her legal fees and her children.

Hilda is a quiet person in her daily life, but outspoken and fearless in the face of injustice. When her husband was detained by ICE and then held for 8 months at the GEO facility in Aurora, CO Hilda worked tirelessly to advocate for his release . The family helped to expose the lack of access to medical care and mishandling of contagious diseases in detention. At the beginning of the pandemic, she led #FreeThemAll calls to action at both detention centers and jails.

Even after her husband‚Äôs deportation, and despite the challenges of being a single mother, she remained committed to fighting for the human rights of all. She has testified in favor of bills at the state capitol and met with many Colorado congresspeople to advocate for just and humane immigration reform and the elimination of immigration detention centers. Most recently she advocated for the new congress to finally tackle an overhaul of our immigration policies, participating in two public direct actions in January alone.

Hilda‚Äôs own immigration case has been slowly winding through the system as she complies with everything asked of her. She applied for asylum as she is very afraid to return to Mexico due to persecution there and is currently in the US on humanitarian parole. Hilda was also the victim of a home invasion and attempted homicide here in the US while awaiting asylum. She has a UVISA application pending from this incident."

See More*Sigue en espa√±ol* Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the age‚Ä¶ Jennifer Piper needs your support for Bring Hilda home - Financial solidarity
